greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = sum of all parts in the k-th column of the shell model of partitions considering only the n-th shell and with its parts aligned to the right margin.
example: For n = 6 and k = 1..6 the 6th shell looks like this:
The sums of all parts in columns 1-6 are
.  0,  0,  0,  2,  9, 20, the same as the 6th row of triangle.
xref: Row sums give A138879. Column sums converge to A014153. Right border gives A046746, n >= 1.
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Apr 22 2012
